owl:Ontology.rdfs:label: General Medicine Repository
owl:Ontology.rdfs:comment: A repository of general medicinal drugs used in civilization.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: Analgesic
owl:Class.rdfs:comment: Top-level root Class for analgesic-typed drug.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: Mood Stabilizer
owl:Class.rdfs:comment: Top-level root Class for mood stabilizer.

owl:Thing.rdfs:label: Aspirin
owl:Thing.rdfs:comment: Medication used to reduce pain, fever or inflammation.

owl:Thing.rdfs:label: Ibuprofen
owl:Thing.rdfs:comment: Medication primarily used for chronic pain management.

owl:Thing.rdfs:label: Salicylic Acid
owl:Thing.rdfs:comment: Medication for inhibiting inflammation, used in treating acne.

owl:Thing.rdfs:label: Diamorphine
owl:Thing.rdfs:comment: A strong pain medication with extremely restricted legal use for cases such as childbirth and heart attack.

owl:Thing.rdfs:label: Oxycodone
owl:Thing.rdfs:comment: Medication for relieving moderate to severe pain.

owl:Thing.rdfs:label: Fentanyl
owl:Thing.rdfs:comment: The most powerful opioid analgesic in existence, typically used in palliative care.

owl:Thing.rdfs:label: Ethanol
owl:Thing.rdfs:comment: Also known as drinking alcohol, used in medicine as an antidote for methanol poisoning.

owl:Thing.rdfs:label: Isopropanol
owl:Thing.rdfs:comment: Also known as isopropyl alcohol, used extensively as a disinfectant.

owl:Thing.rdfs:label: Denatured
owl:Thing.rdfs:comment: Ethanol with additives to discourage recreational use, used extensively for disinfection.

owl:Thing.rdfs:label: Doxepin
owl:Thing.rdfs:comment: Antidepressant medication with strong antihistamine properties.

owl:Thing.rdfs:label: Hydroxyzine
owl:Thing.rdfs:comment: Medication used to treat allergic conditions such as contact dermatitis.

owl:Thing.rdfs:label: Doxylamine
owl:Thing.rdfs:comment: Antihistamine used to treat cold or allergy symptoms, with hypnotic properties.

owl:Thing.rdfs:label: Nizatidine
owl:Thing.rdfs:comment: Antihistamine medication used to treat stomach and intestinal ulcers by inhibiting stomach acid production.

owl:Thing.rdfs:label: Roxatidine
owl:Thing.rdfs:comment: Antihistamine medication used to treat gastric ulcers.

owl:Thing.rdfs:label: Famotidine
owl:Thing.rdfs:comment: Antihistamine medication for relieving heartburn and gastritis.

owl:Thing.rdfs:label: Ciproxifan
owl:Thing.rdfs:comment: Extremely potent antihistamine with properties of wakefulness and attentiveness.

owl:Thing.rdfs:label: Betahistine
owl:Thing.rdfs:comment: Antihistamine medication for treating vertigo and other vertigo-like symptoms.

owl:Thing.rdfs:label: Conessine
owl:Thing.rdfs:comment: Powerful antihistamine used for treating dysentery.

owl:Thing.rdfs:label: Triclosan
owl:Thing.rdfs:comment: Antiseptic agent found in toothpaste, soaps and detergents.

owl:Thing.rdfs:label: Chlorocresol
owl:Thing.rdfs:comment: Antiseptic agent with alternative use as a preservative, allergic to users with sensitive skin.

owl:Thing.rdfs:label: Chloroxylenol
owl:Thing.rdfs:comment: Also known as Dettol, used extensively for disinfecting surgical instruments.

owl:Thing.rdfs:label: Hydrogen Peroxide
owl:Thing.rdfs:comment: Antiseptic agent with versatile use as an oxidizer and bleaching agent.

owl:Thing.rdfs:label: Benzoyl Peroxide
owl:Thing.rdfs:comment: Antiseptic agent with known medicinal use in treating acne.

owl:Thing.rdfs:label: Iodized Salt
owl:Thing.rdfs:comment: Salt with minimal amounts of iodine to curb iodine deficiency.

owl:Thing.rdfs:label: Potassium Iodide
owl:Thing.rdfs:comment: Salt of stable iodine for blocking absorption of radioactive iodine by the thyroid gland.

owl:Thing.rdfs:label: Povidone-Iodine
owl:Thing.rdfs:comment: Antiseptic used for skin disinfection for injuries and surgeries.

owl:Thing.rdfs:label: Dextroamphetamine Sulfate
owl:Thing.rdfs:comment: Stimulant used to treat Attention Deficit Hyperactivity Disorder (ADHD)

owl:Thing.rdfs:label: Amphetamine Sulfate
owl:Thing.rdfs:comment: Stimulant used to treat ADHD and for assisting in weight loss.

owl:Thing.rdfs:label: Benzphetamine
owl:Thing.rdfs:comment: Stimulant with anorectic properties, used for promoting weight loss by reducing appetite and increasing metabolism.

owl:Thing.rdfs:label: Theophylline
owl:Thing.rdfs:comment: Stimulant used for respiratory diseases such as asthma, chronic bronchitis and emphysema.

owl:Thing.rdfs:label: Theobromine
owl:Thing.rdfs:comment: Stimulant typically found in chocolate and tea leaves, effects are considerably weaker than caffeine.

owl:Thing.rdfs:label: Paraxanthine
owl:Thing.rdfs:comment: Stimulant with stronger effects than caffeine with lower toxicity.

owl:Thing.rdfs:label: Cocaine Hydrochloride
owl:Thing.rdfs:comment: Legally permissible cocaine used as local anaesthetic on mucous membranes, typically used for procedures or surgeries on or through nasal cavities of adults.

owl:Thing.rdfs:label: Coca Leaf
owl:Thing.rdfs:comment: Natural form of the tightly-controlled cocaine, very effective against altitude sickness, malaria, ulcers and asthma.

owl:Thing.rdfs:label: Lithium
owl:Thing.rdfs:comment: Mineral used for treating bipolar disorder by decreasing abnormal brain activity.

owl:Thing.rdfs:label: Valproate
owl:Thing.rdfs:comment: Used primarily for treating epilepsy and bipolar disorder, occasionally used to prevent migraine.

owl:Thing.rdfs:label: Lamotrigine
owl:Thing.rdfs:comment: Used solely for treating epilepsy and stabilisation of mood in bipolar disorder patients.

owl:Thing.rdfs:label: Carbamazepine
owl:Thing.rdfs:comment: Used primarily for treating epilepsy, also used in treating schizophrenia and other mental diseases.

owl:Thing.rdfs:label: Asenapine
owl:Thing.rdfs:comment: Antipsychotic medication used to treat schizophrenia and manic depression.

owl:Thing.rdfs:label: Cariprazine
owl:Thing.rdfs:comment: Also called Vraylar, used for treating schizophrenia, bipolar mania and bipolar depression.

owl:Thing.rdfs:label: Lurasidone
owl:Thing.rdfs:comment: Used for treating schizophrenia and bipolar disorder, may be used with lithium or valproate for treatment of bipolar mania.
